speaker: Bloggers
vclaim: George Soros was an SS officer.
date: stated on October 18, 2018 in a post on Facebook:
title: The viral image of an SS officer is not George Soros.
text: Was George Soros from the political right an officer of the protection force? The image of a young man wearing glasses and uniforms, and eyes looking away from the camera, was attributed to the businessman investing in democratic issues. "This is George Soros," read the text stamped above the picture in an article on Facebook on October 18. Remember this the next time liberals funded by Sorus call you racism, fascism or Nazis. This story was highlighted as part of Facebook ' s efforts to combat false news and misleading information in the broadcast of the news. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) The picture is not fake, but it's not George Soros. It's an old picture of Oscar Gruning, one of 300 employees in Auschwitz. On January 12, 2021 Gruning, who died in March, was a confederate in Hitler's special forces, and became known as Auschwitz' accountant, according to New York Times' obsession with another German who faced Holocaust-related war crimes charges. He was accused of being a partner in the murder of some 300,000 Hungarian Jews, and although he asserted that he was only playing an office role in the management of Jewish confiscated funds in the death camp, he admitted that he had witnessed atrocities, including the shooting of Jews who had tried to escape by gas. He was sentenced to four years ' imprisonment at the age of 94. In the meantime, Soros escaped fascism. When the Nazis invaded Hungary, his father obtained false identities for Soros and his brother, according to the 2018 file of billionaires in the New York Times. He sent Soros to live with an agricultural official he inherited as his Christian son. "It is the duty of the official to take stock of confiscated Jewish property" according to the story. "He took George with him." These episodes have become the basis for the allegation that George was a Nazi collaborator. In fact, however, there is no credible evidence that he cooperated with or was sympathetic to the Nazis." We're assessing this statement with pants on fire!
